ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed the skills for writing a longer argumentative research paper, which definitely takes a different skill set than I'd learned in the major.
I was able to complete my senior essay better than I would have without the course.

How to conduct independent research! How to write a thesis-length paper! Seriously, I had never attempted a project of such magnitude before, and I felt constantly supported by my advisor and ENGL 490. It was a lovely experience.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is very engaging, but takes individual motivation, and your experience will definitely be different depending on your relationship to your advisor.
Sometimes it felt like the pacing of the course was off, the first full draft snuck up on me. But the individual exercises on their own were helpful.

The class section itself was wonderful. Strengths: got clear feedback, could brainstorm with classmates, bounce ideas of each other. Weakness: sometimes students would not attend. It might be good to have a librarian come into the class and review citation stuff, etc.
Was a great chance to check in and feel like I had an accountability point for the thesis. Kept us all sane and was very comforting

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this to students who have relationships with their professors and have a specific research interest. It was very fulfilling and engaging.
If you have an idea youre truly passionate about, I would recommend this, but there are other ways to finish the English major.

YES! Writing a thesis was the best way to cap off my studies in the English major. It was wonderful to see the cool projects that my friends were working on, and I got a sense of what grad school might be like.
